> [!NOTE] > ## Other AI code review bot(s) detected > > CodeRabbit has detected other AI code review bot(s) in this pull request and will avoid duplicating their findings in the review comments. This may lead to a less comprehensive review. ## Walkthrough The updates introduce a new documentation section describing multi-command prompt workflows, an automated pull request lifecycle protocol, and a placeholder code detection command. Hook configurations were simplified and unified to use explicit shell invocation with directory changes. PowerShell notification scripts were refined to improve string interpolation. No exported code entities were changed. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Change Summary | |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Documentation Enhancements**
`.claude/commands/exportcommands.md`, `CLAUDE.md` | Added "COMMAND COMBINATION SUPERPOWERS" section for multi-command prompts, detailed the `/pr` command automating the entire pull request lifecycle with fallback strategies, and introduced the `/fake` command for AI-based detection of placeholder code. Added a strict "PR COMMAND COMPLETE AUTOMATION PROTOCOL" forbidding manual PR steps. No removals or signature changes. | | **Hook Configuration Updates**
`.claude/settings.json` | Removed the "PreToolUse" hook, changed "PostToolUse" and "Stop" hooks to run via `bash -c` with explicit `cd` to git root, simplified "Stop" hook structure and updated its description. No changes to exported or public code entities. | | **PowerShell Script String Handling**
`claude_command_scripts/git-header.sh` | Adjusted PowerShell notification functions to wrap string arguments in `$()` expressions for better interpolation, added semicolons at line ends. Logic and control flow remain unchanged; no exported entities modified. | ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 2 (Simple) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~7 minutes ## Poem > A rabbit hopped through docs and code, > Uniting commands in a clever new mode. > Hooks now leap with a bashful spin, > While PowerShell strings get tidy within. > With every tweak, the garden grows bright‚Äî > Hooray for small changes that just feel right! > üêá‚ú® ---
ü™ß Tips ### Chat There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=jleechanorg/worldarchitect.ai&utm_content=1222): - Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example: - `I pushed a fix in commit , please review it.` - `Explain this complex logic.` - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.` - Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples: - `@coderabbitai explain this code block.` - PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples: - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.` - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and explain its main purpose.` - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.` ### Support Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions. ### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments) - `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR. - `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews. - `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository. - `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again. - `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR. - `@coderabbitai generate sequence diagram` to generate a sequence diagram of the changes in this PR. - `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments. - `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository. - `@coderabbitai help` to get help. ### Other keywords and placeholders - Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed. - Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description. - Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically. ### CodeRabbit Configuration File (`.coderabbit.yaml`) - You can programmatically configure CodeRabbit by adding a `.coderabbit.yaml` file to the root of your repository. - Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information. - If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json` ### Documentation and Community - Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit. - Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback. - Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

reviews.body:
## Pull Request Overview

This PR enhances the exportcommands README with detailed documentation of command combination features and fixes Windows/WSL compatibility issues in the git-header.sh script. The changes focus on showcasing the tool's ability to chain multiple commands together and improving cross-platform functionality.

### Key Changes:
- Added comprehensive documentation for command combination capabilities and PR lifecycle automation
- Fixed PowerShell command syntax in git-header.sh for better Windows/WSL compatibility  
- Streamlined Claude hooks configuration by removing redundant entries and improving command paths

### Reviewed Changes

Copilot reviewed 3 out of 3 changed files in this pull request and generated 1 comment.

| File | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| .claude/commands/exportcommands.md | Added new sections documenting command combination features, PR automation workflows, and fake code detection capabilities |
| claude_command_scripts/git-header.sh | Fixed PowerShell syntax by adding semicolons and proper string escaping for Windows/WSL compatibility |
| .claude/settings.json | Simplified hooks configuration by removing PreToolUse entries and fixing command paths with proper bash invocation |

**Bugbot free trial expires on August 9, 2025**
 Learn more in the [Cursor dashboard](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

**Actionable comments posted: 3**
üî≠ Outside diff range comments (1)
claude_command_scripts/git-header.sh (1)
`38-38`: **Quote @{upstream} to avoid brace expansion; handle missing upstream gracefully.** Unquoted `@{upstream}` can trigger brace expansion in Bash. Use the symbolic upstream ref and ensure it doesn‚Äôt error. ```diff -remote=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref @{upstream} 2>/dev/null || echo "no upstream") +remote=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref --symbolic-full-name '@{u}' 2>/dev/null || echo "no upstream") ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (2)
.claude/settings.json (1)
`193-196`: **Same resilience for Stop hook; ensure header runs even if not in a repo.** Mirror the safe fallback to avoid failing when invoked from non-git contexts (e.g., scratch buffers, temp dirs). ```diff - "command": "bash -c 'cd \"$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel)\" && ./claude_command_scripts/git-header.sh'", + "command": "bash -c 'ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || pwd); cd \"$ROOT\" && ./claude_command_scripts/git-header.sh'", ```
.claude/commands/exportcommands.md (1)
`61-73`: **Define parser behavior for multi-command prompts and link to command docs.** Spell out how commands are tokenized (delimiter, ordering, quoting) and link to `/archreview`, `/thinkultra`, `/fake` docs so users know prerequisites and flags. Consider adding: - Exact delimiter semantics (space vs newline). - How to pass arguments to individual commands when combined. - Links: archreview.md, thinkultra.md, fake.md.
